alert.note: Alert for Lake (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 3:44AM EST until January 20 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Localized snowfall amounts in excess of 3 inches expected across far northeast Lake County east of Gary. Little to no snow accumulation expected south of U.S. 30. * WHERE...Lake IN County. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...For portions of northeast Lake County, including the junctions of I-65, I-80, I-90, and I-94, travel is expected to be hazardous under any heavy lake effect snow through at least sunrise. Peak snowfall rates in excess of 2 inches per hour are likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to the nature of lake effect snow, conditions can vary significantly over very short distances, going from flurries to white out conditions over the span of just a few miles. This can also result in highly variable snowfall totals over short distances.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1- 800-261-7623.
